Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and check emails. Skim Hacker News for interesting articles and industry updates before diving into work.
Review last week's notes and any pending action items. Make a to-do list for the day, prioritizing tasks related to the trade execution module.
Schedule a meeting with @larch-1 (Lead Software Architect) to discuss the trade execution module requirements and design. Send out a meeting invite for later this morning.
Dive into researching existing trade execution systems and relevant APIs. Look for open-source libraries or frameworks that could be leveraged.

Meet with @larch-1 to discuss the software modules for trade execution. Brainstorm different architectural approaches, considering scalability, reliability, and security. Take detailed notes and sketch out a high-level module diagram.
Lunch break. Head out for a walk to clear my head and grab a bite to eat. Avoid work-related conversations.
Review the notes and module diagram from the meeting with @larch-1. Refine the design based on the discussion.
Start drafting a technical design document outlining the trade execution module's architecture, components, and interfaces. Focus on clarity and completeness.
Begin setting up the development environment for the trade execution module. Create a new project repository, configure version control (Git), and install necessary dependencies.
Start writing preliminary code for the trade execution module. Begin with the core components, such as the order management system and market data interface.
Wrap up for the day. Commit code changes, review the day's progress, and plan for tomorrow.
